Reviews.Content: stylish Stylish and reasonably priced. This hotel; was in a great location for everything. Little difficult to get large bags from the station to the hotel due to the overpass, but that is the only draw back. Great restaurants nearby and yummy breakfasts everyday.
Reviews.Author: Moguai_Australia

Reviews.Content: Price and location make up for room size Absolutely awesome location - a really short walk from the West Exit of the Shibuya Station, and Shibuya is a great base in Tokyo.I had a single non-smoking room and there certainly wasn't room to swing a cat, but I didn't mind as I only had a backpack and really only needed a bed to sleep on. The bathroom is enclosed in glass to let in the light, and it was well appointed with awesome water pressure. If you were planning to squeeze a second person into the slightly-larger-than-normal single bed, hopefully you won't mind watching them shower.Service was fine, but I didn't do anything more than check in and check out. I didn't ask any questions regarding sight seeing etc. so I can't comment on that.If you're anything like me you look for some clear directions in Trip Advisor reviews to find hotels, so here's some directions you might find helpful. A quick look on Google Earth helps as well!I grabbed the NEX / Suica option to get from Narita (a great deal). As it was an early trip in, I had to change from the Narita Express to Yamanote at Shinagawa, which is a smaller station so getting from one line to the other was a breeze.When you get to Shibuya, make your way to the West Exit. Plenty of signs point the way. When you exit, you'll face a number of bus stops - head left past the toilets and straight up the stairs which go across the road but below the overpass. Keep walking and head down the stairs in front of you. You'll walk along the road which has the red paving leading out of it. A short walk along this road will lead to an intersection - walk up the hill on the road which has the circular paving (it's on the right). The hotel is about 20 metres on the left.
Reviews.Author: Steve4750

Reviews.Content: Great Boutique-y Hotel in Tokyo The Granbell Hotel is a small, chic, boutique-y hotel in the heart of Shibuya. The hotel is super clean (wouldn't expect anything less from Japan) and the receptionists are polite and courteous. I stayed in the smallest room, and it is small but comfortable. Not much room to spread out, but if you're looking for a great place to crash, but don't want to stay in a hostel, this is a great find. Plus it's value for the money. I highly recommend.
Reviews.Author: giraffe123

Reviews.Content: Style, location and price: a triple threat! The Granbell is conveniently located next to the Shibuya train station with easy access to all of shops and restaurants of the area. As opposed to an industrial hotel park, the Granbell is integrated into a neighborhood where you can get a feel for the daily rhythms of the people who live in the city. Similarly, the small number of units give the hotel an intimate feel as well. The accommodations live up to the brochure description as 'designer' -- I particularly liked the glass enclosed shower room with overhead shower nozzle and deep bathtub. Another feature that I found particularly welcome was the adjoining 'Plate of Pies' bar/restaurant -- a 24-hour hipster hang out that serves a limited menu and full bar. The reasonable room rates seal the deal for me.
Reviews.Author: dallhiss

Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and value I am giving this a five star rating due to the price, location and cleanliness. It is truly an excellent value and I had a great stay for three nights in April 2008. The location is close enough to all the action of Shibuya, but just outside enough to have peace and quiet. It's definitely walking distance to the train station, and also walking distance to the famous cross walk that we all know Shibuya for. The staff was very friendly and my single room was the size I expected along with a very nice shower that confirmed the other reviews that I had read.....also had free internet. I would stay at the Granbell again with no worries.
Reviews.Author: JB0715

Reviews.Content: Great design in good location We loved this hotel, it's in a perfect location in Shibuyain a quite street that has great little bars  restaurants.It's only a few minutes walk from the Shibuya train station with cool department stores, shops and the main square.As a designer, I loved the style  feel of the rooms. Theywere a good size for Japanese standards. We booked aroom that had construction outside our window...the staffwere only to happy to upgrade us at no extra fee.The cafe underneath does a breakfast, it's a little expensive not very satisfying. We discovered a western style cafe down the road, they do a great coffee  sandwichfor good prices.From the airport it's tricky to get to. The airport bus will dropyou off at a big chain hotel nearby, then you catch a taxito this hotel. There are no direct airport buses. It's worth it.Well recommended.
Reviews.Author: MIMIVILLE

Reviews.Content: Funky but disappointing When I found the Granbell online I was very excited, it looked very funky and in a great position in Tokyo. Maybe it was because we had just stayed at the wonderful Ryokan Shiraume in Kyoto, but I found the Granbell disappointing. The room was a decent size, still small but not tiny like some in Tokyo. A fantastic shower with great water pressure. A very hard bed, little hanging space and nowhere to put suitcases except on the couch. There was construction going on (an annex being built till June '08) so we had no view but there was no noise either, they don't seem to start at 7am like they do here. The staff spoke very little English, and were very unhelpful with things like restaurant bookings and train timetables. The breakfast was definitely not worth 1000 yen, all you get is a black coffee and a ham and cheese mini roll, you'd be better off going to Excelsior Coffee or somewhere else down the road.Still, if you want somewhere reasonably priced and quite stylish to stay in a good spot in Tokyo, this is it. If you are expecting good service and 'five star' luxury, go elsewhere.
Reviews.Author: foxyflan

Reviews.Content: Those Building Works!       The View from Our Room!
Reviews.Author: besidethesea

Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Granbell       NEW - Double Annex Modern
Reviews.Author: MassiG

Reviews.Content: Loved the Granbell We (family of 4) have just returned from 4 nights at the Granbell and it was great! Others have already commented on the trendy decor and absolutely perfect location. The station and Shibuya centre are five minutes walk, and we walked to Harajuku in one direction and Daikanyama in the other. There are many small eating places around the hotel which is on the quieter side of Shibuya station. Access is so easy - catch the limousine bus to the Cerulean Hotel (easier with luggage and skis than the train). With your back to the Cerulean walk to your right, past the steps to the station, turn right , and the Granbell is in either the third or fourth street on your right - you will have walked past the Family Mart and will turn right up the hill at the four- way intersection opposite the donut shop! Hotel is set back a little on the left-hand side. These were the directions we needed as we asked several people only metres from the hotel and no-one knew, even with the address in Japanese! The blocks are small and the walk is about five minutes.We booked two twin rooms so we could be together (twin and doubles are on different floors). The twin rooms have ample room for suitcases and clothes. Our rooms were the only two at our end of the corridor and perfect for a family.We had no problem with building noise as the annex being built was well below floor nine. Previous reviewer commented on this and it could be a problem if you were at eye level with builders (although we tend to be out during construction hours).Before booking I emailed the hotel with several questions and received prompt, friendly, helpful replies in English.We would certainly stay at the Granbell again.
Reviews.Author: ollie51

Reviews.Content: Great Location and funky rooms but watch out for the building works! Location is great - not far from subway and in the heart of Shibuya where there is lots to see and do.The rooms are small and there's not much space to hang clothes or put your suitcase out of sight. We had a double room and I found only having one side with a bedside table annoying.Toilets are state of the art with music, wash and dry - quite entertaining.When we visited there was building works happening next door from 8am to 8pm most days and all of the double/twin rooms look onto the building site so its rather noisy. I'd check if this was still going on before staying here.
Reviews.Author: TravellerFromOz

Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at Granbell       Granbell entrance
Reviews.Author: January6

Reviews.Content: Budget stay @ Shibuya       Convenience store beside hotel
Reviews.Author: kazataza

Reviews.Content: The Bee's Knees       Granbell Single Room
Reviews.Author: brenton108

Reviews.Content: Modern boutique hotel in a supremely convenient location My boyfriend and I spent 4 wonderful nights at the Granbell hotel in Shibuya, Tokyo. With all the sights to see in Tokyo, we didn't spend much time in the hotel. The hotel's location made it an excellent home base for sightseeing. Just a few minutes from the hotel is Shibuya station, a major subway and train hub. The JR line goes direct from the airport to Shibuya. The hotel is tucked away in a quiet street, yet so close to the action of Shibuya. The location is perfect!We spent 2 days in a double room, left for an overnight trip to the mountains (the hotel was kind enough to store our luggage), then came back and spent another 2 days in a single room for two people. The double room was clean, modern, quiet, and well designed. It had a comfortable bed, gloriously powerful shower, and the obligatory Japanese toilet from the future, as my boyfriend liked to call it.The single room (we booked late and couldn't get a double room for our second stay), was more what we expected from a Japanese hotel. Very small, but still well designed and comfortable. This room is more suited for a single person, as the name states. We found the room rates very resonable.Next time we visit Tokyo we will definitely be staying at the Granbell again. Our stay there was thoroughly enjoyable and we would recommend it without hesitation.
Reviews.Author: slosydney

Reviews.Content: highly recommended me and girlfriend spent 5 nights in april and can only recommend this hotel. quite a stylish place with a very helpfull frontdesk (including free sony vaio rental).very very good location for getting completly lost in the madness that is shibuya. plenty of food options available nearby, a 24 hour snackbar inside the granbell makes a good option for one, or two nightcaps. and of course the bathrooms are hightech ;)
Reviews.Author: ac_z

Reviews.Content: Granbell Hotel Shibuya is a gem My husband and I have just come back from a fabulous 3 night stay at the new Granbell Hotel located in Shibuya, Tokyo. We booked a standard double room (which was a very reasonable price) and found it to be a really funky, cool and comfortable place to stay. The staff were all very friendly and helpful (they lent us a laptop to take to our room to use the internet for free and made lots of bookings for us). The location is amazing as it's only a 3 minute walk to Shibuya station which connects you to many of the train lines to get around Tokyo. It is also only a 5 minute walk to the shops, restaurants and bars of Shibuya.Our room was a good size for Tokyo, ie not cramped and had a very nice shower and bath. The bed was a king size and was very comfortable and we didn't notice any noise during the night.If you are into cool, hip, boutique style hotels in a great location then I would definately recommend staying here. A hint for anyone who has not travelled to Tokyo before, if you are using taxis get your hotel to write down your destination in Japanese to give to the driver as most do not read / understand English.
Reviews.Author: Daltz

Reviews.Content: 銉囥偠銈ゃ兂銇岀礌鏅淬倝銇椼亜   showReview(21638120, 'full');
Reviews.Author: 锝楋綉锝忥綁锝庯絿
